thread.title: Chicago Cubs Say Addison Russell Won't Play in NLCS
thread.title_full: Chicago Cubs Say Addison Russell Won't Play in NLCS

author: Louis Milman
title: Chicago Cubs Say Addison Russell Won't Play in NLCS
text:
Share Article 
Photo by Mark Cunningham/MLB Photos via Getty Images (CHICAGO) -- The Chicago Cubs announced on Thursday that shortstop Addison Russell would not participate in the team's upcoming National League Championship Series appearance.The Cubs advanced to the NLCS with their Game Four victory over the Saint Louis Cardinals. They will go on to face the winner of Thursday night's winner-take-all matchup between the New York Mets and the Los Angeles Dodgers.Russell injured his hamstring in Game Four, the Cubs said. The injury was not initially believed to be particularly severe, but is apparently severe enough to prevent Russell from being a contributor in the upcoming seven-game series. Per @CubsJoeMadd , Addison Russell will not participate in the #NLCS . #Cubs — Chicago Cubs (@Cubs) October 15, 2015 The Cubs would open the NLCS on the road against either the Mets or the Dodgers, with Game One of that series slated for Saturday.
